author: Jesse Newman
title: For U.S. Farmers, China Tariffs’ Timing Is Brutal
text:
Farmers and companies across the agricultural supply chain, many of whom have welcomed some of President Donald Trump’s policies, are bracing for disruption from his escalating trade battle with China.
China is the second-biggest customer for U.S. agricultural products after Canada, and its planned tariffs on pork, fruit, nuts and other goods are expected to worsen the U.S. farm economy’s slump.
